card.name: Accumulated Knowledge
card.ability: Draw a card, then draw cards equal to the number of cards named Accumulated Knowledge in all graveyards.
card.flavor: "I have seen and heard much here. There are secrets within secrets. Let me show you." - Takara, to Eladamri
card.ruling: 10/4/2004: The count does not include the card that is currently resolving. The card does not go to the graveyard until after it is done resolving.

card.name: Acidic Slime
card.ability:
Deathtouch (Any amount of damage this deals to a creature is enough to destroy it.)
When Acidic Slime enters the battlefield, destroy target artifact, enchantment, or land.

card.name: Albino Troll
card.ability:
Echo {1}{G} (At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)
{1}{G}: Regenerate Albino Troll.

card.name: Anathemancer
card.ability:
When Anathemancer enters the battlefield, it deals damage to target player equal to the number of nonbasic lands that player controls.
Unearth {5}{B}{R} ({5}{B}{R}: Return this card from your graveyard to the battlefield. It gains haste. Exile it at the beginning of the next end step or if it would leave the battlefield. Unearth only as a sorcery.)

card.name: Ancient Grudge
card.ability:
Destroy target artifact.
Flashback {G} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
card.flavor: If there's anything a werewolf hates, it's a collar—especially Avacyn's Collar, the symbol of her church.

card.name: Ancient Ziggurat
card.ability: {T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool. Spend this mana only to cast a creature spell.
card.flavor: Leylines branch out from its foundation like roots from a tree. These draw mana from every region and welcome all living things into its verdant chambers.
card.ruling:
2/1/2009: Mana produced by Ancient Ziggurat can be spent on any part of a creature spell's total cost. This includes additional costs (such as kicker) and alternative costs (such as evoke or Worldheart Phoenix's alternative cost).

2/1/2009: Mana produced by Ancient Ziggurat can't be spent on activated abilities that put a creature card directly onto the battlefield, such as unearth or ninjutsu.

card.name: Armadillo Cloak
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 and has trample.
Whenever enchanted creature deals damage, you gain that much life.
card.flavor: "Don't laugh. It works." -Yavimaya ranger

card.name: Arrogant Wurm
card.ability:
Trample
Madness {2}{G} (If you discard this card, you may cast it for its madness cost instead of putting it into your graveyard.)
card.flavor: It's hard to be humble when the whole world is bite size.

card.name: Artisan of Kozilek
card.ability:
When you cast Artisan of Kozilek, you may return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield.
Annihilator 2 (Whenever this creature attacks, defending player sacrifices two permanents.)
card.ruling:
6/15/2010: Annihilator abilities trigger and resolve during the declare attackers step. The defending player chooses and sacrifices the required number of permanents before he or she declares blockers. Any creatures sacrificed this way won't be able to block.

6/15/2010: If a creature with annihilator is attacking a planeswalker, and the defending player chooses to sacrifice that planeswalker, the attacking creature continues to attack. It may be blocked. If it isn't blocked, it simply won't deal combat damage to anything.

6/15/2010: In a Two-Headed Giant game, the controller of an attacking creature with annihilator chooses which of the defending players is affected by the ability. Only that player sacrifices permanents. The choice is made as the ability resolves; once a player is chosen, it's too late for anyone to respond.

card.name: Astral Slide
card.ability: Whenever a player cycles a card, you may exile target creature. If you do, return that card to the battlefield under its owner's control at the beginning of the next end step.
card.flavor:
"The hum of the universe is never off-key."
-Mystic elder
card.ruling:
10/4/2004: If a player cycles a card during the end of turn step, the creature that is exiled won't come back until the end of the next turn.

8/1/2008: If a face-down card is exiled, it turns face-up and remains face-up when it returns to the battlefield. This does not trigger any abilities that would trigger on it being turned face-up

card.name: Aura of Silence
card.ability:
Artifact and enchantment spells your opponents cast cost {2} more to cast.
Sacrifice Aura of Silence: Destroy target artifact or enchantment.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004: Aura of Silence affects all opponents in a multiplayer game.

card.name: Avacyn's Pilgrim
card.ability: {T}: Add {W} to your mana pool.
card.flavor: "Avacyn's protection is everywhere. From the holy church to the sacred glade, all that we see is under her blessed watch."

card.name: Avalanche Riders
card.ability:
Haste
Echo {3}{R} (At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)
When Avalanche Riders enters the battlefield, destroy target land.

card.name: Basking Rootwalla
card.ability:
{1}{G}: Basking Rootwalla gets +2/+2 until end of turn. Activate this ability only once each turn.
Madness {0} (If you discard this card, you may cast it for its madness cost instead of putting it into your graveyard.)
card.ruling: 2/1/2006: If this card's ability is activated by one player, then another player takes control of it on the same turn, the second player can't activate its ability that turn.

card.name: Black Knight
card.ability:
First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
Protection from white (This creature can't be blocked, targeted, dealt damage, or enchanted by anything white.)
card.flavor: "The chill, to him who breathed it, drew / Down with his blood, till all his heart was cold." - Alfred, Lord Tennyson, Idyls of the King

card.name: Blastoderm
card.ability:
Shroud (This permanent can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
Fading 3 (This creature enters the battlefield with three fade counters on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a fade counter from it. If you can't, sacrifice it.)

card.name: Bloodbraid Elf
card.ability:
Haste
Cascade (When you cast this spell, exile cards from the top of your library until you exile a nonland card that costs less. You may cast it without paying its mana cost. Put the exiled cards on the bottom in a random order.)
card.ruling:
5/1/2009: Cascade triggers when you cast the spell, meaning that it resolves before that spell. If you end up casting the exiled card, it will go on the stack above the spell with Cascade.

5/1/2009: When the Cascade ability resolves, you must exile cards. The only optional part of the ability is whether or not your cast the last card exiled.

5/1/2009: If a spell with Cascade is countered, the Cascade ability will still resolve normally.

5/1/2009: You exile the cards face-up. All players will be able to see them.

5/1/2009: If you exile a split card with Cascade, check if at least one half of that split card has a converted mana cost that's less than the converted mana cost of the spell with cascade. If so, you can cast either half of that split card.

5/1/2009: If you cast the last exiled card, you're casting it as a spell. It can be countered. If that card has cascade, the new spell's cascade ability will trigger, and you'll repeat the process for the new spell.

5/1/2009: After you're done exiling cards and casting the last one if you chose to do so, the remaining exiled cards are randomly placed on the bottom of your library. Neither you nor any other player is allowed to know the order of those cards.

card.name: Bottle Gnomes
card.ability: Sacrifice Bottle Gnomes: You gain 3 life.
card.flavor: "I am reminded of the fable of the silver egg. Its owner cracks it open to see what jewels it holds, only to discover a simple yellow yolk." - Karn, silver golem

card.name: Brainstorm
card.ability: Draw three cards, then put two cards from your hand on top of your library in any order.
card.flavor: "I see more than other because I know where to look" -Saprazzan vizier
card.ruling: 10/4/2004: This is all one effect. You draw 3 and return 2 cards all in one resolution. Nothing may happen between the two. If something triggers on drawing cards, it will go on the stack after Brainstorm finishes resolving.

card.name: Browbeat
card.ability: Any player may have Browbeat deal 5 damage to him or her. If no one does, target player draws three cards.
card.flavor:
"Even the threat of power has power."
-Jeska, warrior adept

card.name: Cabal Coffers
card.ability: {2}, {T}: Add {B} to your mana pool for each Swamp you control.
card.flavor: Deep within the Cabal's vault, the Mirari pulsed like a dead sun-and its darkness radiated across Otaria.

card.name: Cabal Therapy
card.ability:
Name a nonland card. Target player reveals his or her hand and discards all cards with that name.
Flashback—Sacrifice a creature. (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
card.ruling: 10/4/2004: You name the card during resolution, then your opponent reveals their hand and discards if appropriate. There is no way for your opponent to do anything between you naming the card and them discarding.

card.name: Call of the Conclave
card.ability: Put a 3/3 green Centaur creature token onto the battlefield.
card.flavor: Centaurs are sent to evangelize in Gruul territories where words of war speak louder than prayers of peace.

card.name: Capsize
card.ability:
Buyback {3} (You may pay an additional {3} as you cast this spell. If you do, put this card into your hand as it resolves.)
Return target permanent to its owner's hand.

card.name: Carnophage
card.ability: At the beginning of your upkeep, tap Carnophage unless you pay 1 life.
card.flavor: "And in their blind and unattaining state their miserable lives have sunk so low that they must envy every other fate." - Dante, Inferno, trans. Ciardi

card.name: Carrion Feeder
card.ability:
Carrion Feeder can't block.
Sacrifice a creature: Put a +1/+1 counter on Carrion Feeder.
card.flavor: Stinking of rot, it leaps between gravestones in search of its next meal.

card.name: Chainer's Edict
card.ability:
Target player sacrifices a creature.
Flashback {5}{B}{B} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
card.flavor: The pits have their own form of mercy.

card.name: Circle of Protection: Red
card.ability: {1}: The next time a red source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004: A source of damage is a permanent, a spell on the stack (including one that creates a permanent), or any object referred to by an object on the stack. A source doesn't need to be capable of dealing damage to be a legal choice.

10/4/2004: Can be used even when there is no damage to prevent. It prevents the next damage (if any) from the source this turn.

card.name: Circular Logic
card.ability:
Counter target spell unless its controller pays {1} for each card in your graveyard.
Madness {U} (If you discard this card, you may cast it for its madness cost instead of putting it into your graveyard.)

card.name: Cloudpost
card.ability:
Cloudpost enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool for each Locus on the battlefield.
card.flavor: "He watches from above. He watches from below. He watches from within." -Inscription on Tel-Jilad, the Tree of Tales

card.name: Contagion Clasp
card.ability:
When Contagion Clasp enters the battlefield, put a -1/-1 counter on target creature.
{4}, {T}: Proliferate. (You choose any number of permanents and/or players with counters on them, then give each another counter of a kind already there.)
card.ruling:
1/1/2011: You can choose any player that has a counter, including yourself.

1/1/2011: You can choose any permanent that has a counter, including ones controlled by opponents. You can't choose cards in any zone other than the battlefield, even if they have counters on them, such as suspended cards or a Lightning Storm on the stack.

1/1/2011: You don't have to choose every permanent or player that has a counter, only the ones you want to add another counter to. Since "any number" includes zero, you don't have to choose any permanents at all, and you don't have to choose any players at all.

1/1/2011: If a permanent chosen this way has multiple kinds of counters on it, only a single new counter is put on that permanent.

1/1/2011: Players can respond to the spell or ability whose effect includes proliferating. Once that spell or ability starts to resolve, however, and its controller chooses which permanents and players will get new counters, it's too late for anyone to respond.

1/1/2011: Contagion Clasp's first ability is mandatory. If you're the only player who controls a creature, you must target one of them.

card.name: Counterspell
card.ability: Counter target spell.
card.flavor: "It was probably a lousy spell in the first place." -Ertai, wizard adept

card.name: Crystalline Sliver
card.ability: All Slivers have shroud. (They can't be the targets of spells or abilities.)
card.flavor: Bred as living shields, these slivers have proven unruly-they know they cannot be caught.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004: The ability only applies while this card is on the battlefield.

card.name: Cultivate
card.ability: Search your library for up to two basic land cards, reveal those cards, and put one onto the battlefield tapped and the other into your hand. Then shuffle your library.
card.flavor: All seeds share a common bond, calling to each other across infinity.
card.ruling: 8/15/2010: If you choose to find only one basic land card, you put it onto the battlefield tapped.

card.name: Life // Death
card.ability:
Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield. You lose life equal to its converted mana cost.
//
All lands you control become 1/1 creatures until end of turn. They're still lands.
card.ruling: 8/1/2008: A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature is subject to the "summoning sickness" rule: It can only attack, and its {T} abilities can only be activated, if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of his or her most recent turn.

card.name: Deep Analysis
card.ability:
Target player draws two cards.
Flashback—{1}{U}, Pay 3 life. (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
card.flavor: "The specimen seems to be broken."

card.name: Desert
card.ability:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{T}: Desert deals 1 damage to target attacking creature. Activate this ability only during the end of combat step.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004: The ability can be used on any player's attacking creatures. This includes your own and creatures in an attack you are not involved in (for multiplayer games).

card.name: Despise
card.ability: Target opponent reveals his or her hand. You choose a creature or planeswalker card from it. That player discards that card.
card.flavor: "Truth is always a weapon in your enemies' hands."—Geth, Lord of the Vault

card.name: Disenchant
card.ability: Destroy target artifact or enchantment.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004: This is not modal. If the target changes from an artifact to an enchantment or vice versa, this still destroys it.

card.name: Dismember
card.ability:
({PB} can be paid with either {B} or 2 life.)
Target creature gets -5/-5 until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"You serve Phyrexia. Your pieces would better serve Phyrexia elsewhere."
—Azax-Azog, the Demon Thane
card.ruling:
6/1/2011: A card with Phyrexian mana symbols in its mana cost is each color that appears in that mana cost, regardless of how that cost may have been paid.

6/1/2011: To calculate the converted mana cost of a card with Phyrexian mana symbols in its cost, count each Phyrexian mana symbol as 1.

6/1/2011: As you cast a spell or activate an activated ability with one or more Phyrexian mana symbols in its cost, you choose how to pay for each Phyrexian mana symbol at the same time you would choose modes or choose a value for X.

6/1/2011: If you're at 1 life or less, you can't pay 2 life.

6/1/2011: Phyrexian mana is not a new color. Players can't add Phyrexian mana to their mana pools.

card.name: Dissipate
card.ability: Counter target spell. If that spell is countered this way, exile it instead of putting it into its owner's graveyard.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004: The card does not go to the graveyard before being exiled.

10/4/2004: If the spell is not countered (because the spell it targets can't be countered), then it does not get exiled.

card.name: Drain Life
card.ability:
Spend only black mana on X.
Drain Life deals X damage to target creature or player. You gain life equal to the damage dealt, but not more life than the player's life total before Drain Life dealt damage or the creature's toughness.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004: Cost reducers can be used to reduce the X part of the mana cost.

10/4/2004: You may gain up to the total toughness of the creature even if it was already damaged.

card.name: Duress
card.ability: Target opponent reveals his or her hand. You choose a noncreature, nonland card from it. That player discards that card.
card.flavor: "We decide who is worthy of our works." -Gix, Yawgmoth praetor

card.name: Elves of Deep Shadow
card.ability: {T}: Add {B} to your mana pool. Elves of Deep Shadow deals 1 damage to you.
card.flavor: "They are aberrations who have turned on everything we hold sacred. Let them be cast out." -Ailheen, Speaker of the Council

card.name: Elvish Visionary
card.ability: When Elvish Visionary enters the battlefield, draw a card.
card.flavor: Before any major undertaking, a Cylian elf seeks the guidance of a visionary to learn the will of the gargantuan ancients.

card.name: Engineered Plague
card.ability:
As Engineered Plague enters the battlefield, choose a creature type.
All creatures of the chosen type get -1/-1.
card.flavor: A single germ can kill more soldiers than ten thousand blades.

card.name: Eternal Witness
card.ability: When Eternal Witness enters the battlefield, you may return target card from your graveyard to your hand.
card.flavor: Gaea needs no book to record every act.

card.name: Everflowing Chalice
card.ability:
Multikicker {2} (You may pay an additional {2} any number of times as you cast this spell.)
Everflowing Chalice enters the battlefield with a charge counter on it for each time it was kicked.
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool for each charge counter on Everflowing Chalice.
card.ruling: 3/1/2010: If Everflowing Chalice has no charge counters on it, you can still activate its last ability. That ability is still a mana ability, even though it produces no mana as it resolves.

card.name: Evolving Wilds
card.ability: {T}, Sacrifice Evolving Wilds: Search your library for a basic land card and put it onto the battlefield tapped. Then shuffle your library.
card.flavor: Without the interfering hands of civilization, nature will always shape itself to its own needs.

card.name: Fact or Fiction
card.ability: Reveal the top five cards of your library. An opponent separates those cards into two piles. Put one pile into your hand and the other into your graveyard.
card.flavor: "Try to pretend like you understand what's important."
card.ruling:
10/4/2004: You choose which pile to put into your hand.

10/4/2004: The revealed cards are revealed in order, so that all players know what order they were on the library.

card.name: Farseek
card.ability: Search your library for a Plains, Island, Swamp, or Mountain card and put it onto the battlefield tapped. Then shuffle your library.
card.flavor: "How truly vast this city must be, that I have traveled so far and seen so much, yet never once found the place where the buildings fail."
card.ruling: 7/1/2012: The card can have other land types, including Forest, as long as it also has one of the listed land types.

card.name: Fire // Ice
card.ability:
Fire deals 2 damage divided as you choose among one or two target creatures and/or players.
//
Tap target permanent.
Draw a card.

card.name: Fireblast
card.ability:
You may sacrifice two Mountains rather than pay Fireblast's mana cost.
Fireblast deals 4 damage to target creature or player.

card.name: Firebolt
card.ability:
Firebolt deals 2 damage to target creature or player.
Flashback {4}{R} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
card.flavor: Reach out and torch someone.

card.name: Fireslinger
card.ability: {T}: Fireslinger deals 1 damage to target creature or player and 1 damage to you.
card.flavor: "One pain is lessened by another's anguish." - William Shakespeare, Romeo and Juliet

card.name: Flametongue Kavu
card.ability: When Flametongue Kavu enters the battlefield, it deals 4 damage to target creature.
card.flavor: "For dim-witted, thick-skulled genetic mutants, they have pretty good aim." - Sisay
card.ruling: 10/4/2004: If it enters the battlefield as the only targetable creature, it must target itself.

card.name: Forbid
card.ability:
Buyback—Discard two cards. (You may discard two cards in addition to any other costs as you cast this spell. If you do, put this card into your hand as it resolves.)
Counter target spell.

card.name: Forbidden Alchemy
card.ability:
Look at the top four cards of your library. Put one of them into your hand and the rest into your graveyard.
Flashback {6}{B} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
card.ruling: 9/22/2011: If you have fewer than four cards in your library, you'll look at all the cards there and put one into your hand and the rest into your graveyard.

card.name: Force Spike
card.ability: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {1}.
card.flavor: "I don't think so."
card.ruling: 10/4/2004: The payment is optional.

card.name: Gatekeeper of Malakir
card.ability:
Kicker {B} (You may pay an additional {B} as you cast this spell.)
When Gatekeeper of Malakir enters the battlefield, if it was kicked, target player sacrifices a creature.
card.flavor: "You may enter the city—once the toll is paid."

card.name: Gerrard's Verdict
card.ability: Target player discards two cards. You gain 3 life for each land card discarded this way.
card.flavor: A heart of light and a soul of darkness cannot coexist.

card.name: Ghostly Prison
card.ability: Creatures can't attack you unless their controller pays {2} for each creature he or she controls that's attacking you.
card.flavor: "May the memory of our fallen heroes ensnare the violent hearts of lesser men." -Great Threshold of Monserkat inscription
card.ruling: 2/1/2007: In the Two-Headed Giant format, you still only have to pay once per creature.

card.name: Giant Growth
card.ability: Target creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn.

card.name: Gitaxian Probe
card.ability:
({PU} can be paid with either {U} or 2 life.)
Look at target player's hand.
Draw a card.
card.flavor:
"My flesh holds no secrets, monster. The spirit of Mirrodin will fight on."
—Vy Covalt, Mirran resistance
card.ruling:
6/1/2011: A card with Phyrexian mana symbols in its mana cost is each color that appears in that mana cost, regardless of how that cost may have been paid.

6/1/2011: To calculate the converted mana cost of a card with Phyrexian mana symbols in its cost, count each Phyrexian mana symbol as 1.

6/1/2011: As you cast a spell or activate an activated ability with one or more Phyrexian mana symbols in its cost, you choose how to pay for each Phyrexian mana symbol at the same time you would choose modes or choose a value for X.

6/1/2011: If you're at 1 life or less, you can't pay 2 life.

6/1/2011: Phyrexian mana is not a new color. Players can't add Phyrexian mana to their mana pools.

6/1/2011: The targeted player may have no cards in his or her hand. You'll still draw a card.

card.name: Glistener Elf
card.ability: Infect (This creature deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)
card.flavor: "Beg me for life, and I will fill you with the glory of Phyrexian perfection."

card.name: Go for the Throat
card.ability: Destroy target nonartifact creature.
card.flavor: Having flesh is increasingly a liability on Mirrodin.
card.ruling: 6/1/2011: If the targeted creature is also an artifact when Go for the Throat tries to resolve, it will be countered.

card.name: Goblin Bombardment
card.ability: Sacrifice a creature: Goblin Bombardment deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
card.flavor: One mogg to aim the catapult, one mogg to steer the rock.

card.name: Goblin Legionnaire
card.ability:
{R}, Sacrifice Goblin Legionnaire: Goblin Legionnaire deals 2 damage to target creature or player.
{W}, Sacrifice Goblin Legionnaire: Prevent the next 2 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.

card.name: Goblin Ringleader
card.ability:
Haste
When Goblin Ringleader enters the battlefield, reveal the top four cards of your library. Put all Goblin cards revealed this way into your hand and the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.

card.name: Goblin Warchief
card.ability:
Goblin spells you cast cost {1} less to cast.
Goblin creatures you control have haste.
card.flavor: They poured from the Skirk Ridge like lava, burning and devouring everything in their path.

card.name: Fire // Ice
card.ability:
Fire deals 2 damage divided as you choose among one or two target creatures and/or players.
//
Tap target permanent.
Draw a card.

card.name: Icy Manipulator
card.ability: {1}, {T}: Tap target artifact, creature, or land.
card.flavor: In fire there is the spark of chaos and destruction, the seed of life. In ice there is perfect tranquility, perfect order, and the silence of death.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004: Tapping a card with an effect like this will never pay the cost of an ability. For example, tapping a land with this card will not put mana into a player's pool.

10/4/2004: Icy Manipulator can't be used to stop someone from using an ability of the permanent you plan to tap. It can be used to make a player use the ability now or to not use it.

10/4/2004: The ability can target a tapped card, but tapping a tapped card does nothing useful. And it will not trigger "if the card becomes tapped" effects.

10/4/2004: If you want to stop someone from attacking with a creature by using this card, you must do so before attackers are declared. You can't wait until after attackers are declared and then try to use it to make a creature stop attacking. Note that your opponent can't start declaring attackers without letting you use the Icy Manipulator.

10/4/2004: Tapping an attacking creature which did not tap to attack does not remove the creature from the attack or cause the creature to stop dealing damage.

card.name: Impulse
card.ability: Look at the top four cards of your library. Put one of them into your hand and the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004: This is not a draw.

10/4/2004: Due to errata, you no longer shuffle your library.

card.name: Isochron Scepter
card.ability:
Imprint — When Isochron Scepter enters the battlefield, you may exile an instant card with converted mana cost 2 or less from your hand.
{2}, {T}: You may copy the exiled card. If you do, you may cast the copy without paying its mana cost.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004: If the imprinted card leaves the Exile zone while the ability to make a copy is on the stack, then no copy will be made.

10/4/2004: If this card leaves the battlefield while the ability to make a copy is on the stack, the ability will still make a copy using the last-known-information rule.

12/1/2004: Isochron Scepter's second ability creates a copy of the imprinted card in the Exile zone (that's where the imprinted Instant card is), then allows you to cast it without paying its mana cost.

12/1/2004: You cast the copy while this ability is resolving, and still on the stack. Normally, you're not allowed to cast spells or activate abilities at this time. Isochron Scepter's ability provides an exception.

12/1/2004: You don't pay the spell's mana cost. If the spell has X in its mana cost, X is 0. You do pay any additional costs for that spell. You can't use any alternative costs.

12/1/2004: If the copied card is a split card, you may choose to cast either side of the split card, but not both. The split cards Fire/Ice, Illusion/Reality, Night/Day, Stand/Deliver, and Wax/Wane all have at least one side with converted mana cost 2 or less.)

12/1/2004: You can't cast the copy if an effect prevents you from casting Instants or from casting that particular Instant.

12/1/2004: You can't cast the copy unless all of its targets can be chosen.

12/1/2004: If you don't want to cast the copy, you can choose not to; the copy ceases to exist the next time state-based actions are checked.

3/1/2005: The creation of the copy and then the casting of the copy are both optional.

card.name: Jace's Ingenuity
card.ability: Draw three cards.
card.flavor: "Brute force can sometimes kick down a locked door, but knowledge is a skeleton key."

card.name: Jackal Pup
card.ability: Whenever Jackal Pup is dealt damage, it deals that much damage to you.
card.flavor: "Cry havoc and let slip the dogs of war." - William Shakespeare, Julius Caesar

card.name: Judge's Familiar
card.ability:
Flying
Sacrifice Judge's Familiar: Counter target instant or sorcery spell unless its controller pays {1}.
card.flavor:
"It misses nothing and it has no sense of humor."
—Barvisa, courtroom scribe

card.name: Juggernaut
card.ability:
Juggernaut attacks each turn if able.
Juggernaut can't be blocked by Walls.
card.flavor: Built with neither a way to steer nor a way to stop, the juggernauts were simply aimed at an enemy's best defenses and told to charge.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004: An effect that states "Enchanted creature can only be blocked by Walls" will make the Juggernaut unblockable. The "can only be blocked by walls" effect doesn't override the text on the Juggernaut's ability.

10/4/2004: There is no penalty if for some reason the Juggernaut can't attack, but if it can attack you must do so.

8/15/2010: If, during your declare attackers step, Juggernaut is tapped, is affected by a spell or ability that says it can't attack, or is affected by "summoning sickness," then it doesn't attack. If there's a cost associated with having Juggernaut attack, you aren't forced to pay that cost, so it doesn't have to attack in that case either.

8/15/2010: If there are multiple combat phases in a turn, Juggernaut must attack only in the first one in which it's able to.

card.name: Kird Ape
card.ability: Kird Ape gets +1/+2 as long as you control a Forest.
card.flavor: It puts the "fur" in "fury."

card.name: Kitchen Finks
card.ability:
When Kitchen Finks enters the battlefield, you gain 2 life.
Persist (When this creature dies, if it had no -1/-1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a -1/-1 counter on it.)

card.name: Krosan Grip
card.ability:
Split second (As long as this spell is on the stack, players can't cast spells or activate abilities that aren't mana abilities.)
Destroy target artifact or enchantment.
card.flavor:
"Give up these unnatural weapons, these scrolls. Heart and mind and fist are enough."
-Zyd, Kamahlite druid

card.name: Krosan Tusker
card.ability:
Cycling {2}{G} ({2}{G}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
When you cycle Krosan Tusker, you may search your library for a basic land card, reveal that card, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.
card.ruling:
10/1/2008: Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

10/1/2008: When you cycle this card, first the cycling ability goes on the stack, then the triggered ability goes on the stack on top of it. The triggered ability will resolve before you draw a card from the cycling ability.

10/1/2008: The cycling ability and the triggered ability are separate. If the triggered ability is countered (with Stifle, for example, or if all its targets have become illegal), the cycling ability will still resolve and you'll draw a card.

card.name: Krosan Warchief
card.ability:
Beast spells you cast cost {1} less to cast.
{1}{G}: Regenerate target Beast.
card.flavor: It turns prey into predator.

card.name: Life // Death
card.ability:
Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield. You lose life equal to its converted mana cost.
//
All lands you control become 1/1 creatures until end of turn. They're still lands.
card.ruling: 8/1/2008: A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature is subject to the "summoning sickness" rule: It can only attack, and its {T} abilities can only be activated, if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of his or her most recent turn.

card.name: Lightning Greaves
card.ability:
Equipped creature has haste and shroud. (It can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
Equip {0}
card.flavor: After lightning struck the cliffs, the ore became iron, the iron became steel, and the steel became greaves. The lightning never left.
card.ruling: 4/15/2013: You are not allowed to "unequip" equipment from a creature. If Lightning Greaves is attached to the only creature you control, you won't be able to attach other equipment to it (or target it with anything else) until you have another creature onto which you can move Lightning Greaves.

card.name: Lightning Rift
card.ability: Whenever a player cycles a card, you may pay {1}. If you do, Lightning Rift deals 2 damage to target creature or player.
card.flavor: Options will cost you, but a lack of options will cost you even more.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004: You choose the target when this ability is put on the stack, but you do not decide whether or not to pay the mana until the ability resolves.

card.name: Lingering Souls
card.ability:
Put two 1/1 white Spirit creature tokens with flying onto the battlefield.
Flashback {1}{B} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
card.flavor: The murdered inhabitants of Hollowhenge impart to the living the terror they felt in death.

card.name: Llanowar Elves
card.ability: {T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.

card.name: Lobotomy
card.ability: Target player reveals his or her hand, then you choose a card other than a basic land card from it. Search that player's graveyard, hand, and library for all cards with the same name as the chosen card and exile them. Then that player shuffles his or her library.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004: You only get to pick one card from the player's hand.

10/4/2004: If the player has no cards in their hand, you still get to look through their deck, but you do not get to exile any cards.

10/4/2004: It exiles the chosen card plus all others in the hand, library, and graveyard. Some people thought the chosen card was not exiled due to some vague wording.

10/4/2004: Does not affect cards on the battlefield.

2/1/2005: The copies must be found if they are in publicly viewable zones. Finding copies while searching private zones is optional.

card.name: Longbow Archer
card.ability: First strike; reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
card.flavor: "If it bears wings, I will pin it to the skies over Tefemburu." - Roya, Zhalfirin archer
card.ruling: 4/1/2008: This card now uses the Reach keyword ability to enable the blocking of flying creatures. This works because a creature with flying can only be blocked by creatures with flying or reach.

card.name: Magma Jet
card.ability:
Magma Jet deals 2 damage to target creature or player.
Scry 2. (To scry 2, look at the top two cards of your library, then put any number of them on the bottom of your library and the rest on top in any order.)

card.name: Merrow Reejerey
card.ability:
Other Merfolk creatures you control get +1/+1.
Whenever you cast a Merfolk spell, you may tap or untap target permanent.
card.flavor: Steady and silent as the deep current, the reejerey guides the course of the school.

card.name: Mind Warp
card.ability: Look at target player's hand and choose X cards from it. That player discards those cards.
card.flavor: The hardest of wizards can have the softest of minds.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004: The target player decides what order to put the cards in the graveyard. You decide which cards, but they do the discarding.

card.name: Mogg Fanatic
card.ability: Sacrifice Mogg Fanatic: Mogg Fanatic deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
card.flavor: "As if his chest had been a mortar, he burst his hot heart's shell upon it." - Herman Melville, Moby Dick

card.name: Mother of Runes
card.ability: {T}: Target creature you control gains protection from the color of your choice until end of turn.
card.flavor: "My family protects all families."

card.name: Mulldrifter
card.ability:
Flying
When Mulldrifter enters the battlefield, draw two cards.
Evoke {2}{U} (You may cast this spell for its evoke cost. If you do, it's sacrificed when it enters the battlefield.)

card.name: Murderous Redcap
card.ability:
When Murderous Redcap enters the battlefield, it deals damage equal to its power to target creature or player.
Persist (When this creature dies, if it had no -1/-1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a -1/-1 counter on it.)
card.ruling: 5/1/2008: Murderous Redcap's power is checked at the time the ability resolves. If it's left the battlefield by then, its last known information is used.

card.name: Muscle Sliver
card.ability: All Sliver creatures get +1/+1.
card.flavor: The air was filled with the cracks and snaps of flesh hardening as the new sliver joined the battle.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004: Yes, it does give the +1/+1 bonus to itself.

card.name: Myr Enforcer
card.ability: Affinity for artifacts (This spell costs {1} less to cast for each artifact you control.)
card.flavor: Most myr monitor other species. Some myr monitor other myr.

card.name: Oblivion Ring
card.ability:
When Oblivion Ring enters the battlefield, exile another target nonland permanent.
When Oblivion Ring leaves the battlefield, return the exiled card to the battlefield under its owner's control.
card.ruling:
10/1/2007: If Oblivion Ring leaves the battlefield before its first ability has resolved, its second ability will trigger and do nothing. Then its first ability will resolve and exile the targeted nonland permanent forever.

10/1/2007: If there are no nonland permanents on the battlefield other than an Oblivion Ring, and the card it exiled was another Oblivion Ring, casting a third Oblivion Ring will result in an involuntary infinite loop that will end the game in a draw (unless someone chooses to break it by putting another nonland permanent onto the battlefield or destroying one of the Oblivion Rings, for example).

10/1/2008: If the exiled card is an Aura, that card's owner chooses what it will enchant as it comes back onto the battlefield. An Aura put onto the battlefield this way doesn't target anything, but the Aura's enchant ability restricts what it can be attached to. If the Aura can't legally be attached to anything, it remains exiled forever.

7/1/2012: Auras attached to the exiled permanent will be put into their owners' graveyards. Equipment attached to the exiled permanent will become unattached and remain on the battlefield. Any counters on the exiled permanent will cease to exist.

card.name: Ophidian
card.ability: Whenever Ophidian attacks and isn't blocked, you may draw a card. If you do, Ophidian assigns no combat damage this turn.
card.flavor: "I will ... tell thee more than thou hast wit to ask."- Christopher Marlowe, Doctor Faustus
card.ruling: 4/15/2013: An ability that triggers when something "attacks and isn't blocked" triggers in the declare blockers step after blockers are declared if (1) that creature is attacking and (2) no creatures are declared to block it. It will trigger even if that creature was put onto the battlefield attacking rather than having been declared as an attacker in the declare attackers step.

card.name: Pendelhaven
card.ability:
{T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.
{T}: Target 1/1 creature gets +1/+2 until end of turn.
card.flavor: The limbs of Pendelhaven extend as far as the meek roam, and reach as high as they strive.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004: The current power/toughness being 1/1 is a targeting requirement so it is checked when announcing and again right before resolving.

card.name: Pillar of Flame
card.ability: Pillar of Flame deals 2 damage to target creature or player. If a creature dealt damage this way would die this turn, exile it instead.
card.flavor: "May the worthy spend an eternity in Blessed Sleep. May the wicked find the peace of oblivion."
card.ruling:
5/1/2012: A creature dealt damage by Pillar of Flame that dies that turn will be exiled even if it wasn't the target of Pillar of Flame (because the damage was redirected somehow).

5/1/2012: A creature dealt damage by Pillar of Flame that turn will be exiled no matter why the creature would die. It could have its toughness reduced to 0 or less or be destroyed by another spell or ability.

card.name: Priest of Titania
card.ability: {T}: Add {G} to your mana pool for each Elf on the battlefield.
card.flavor: Titania rewards all who honor the forest by making them a living part of it.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004: Since he is an Elf, he counts himself.

card.name: Prodigal Sorcerer
card.ability: {T}: Prodigal Sorcerer deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

card.name: Qasali Pridemage
card.ability:
Exalted (Whenever a creature you control attacks alone, that creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
{1}, Sacrifice Qasali Pridemage: Destroy target artifact or enchantment.
card.flavor: An elder in one pride, of the Sigiled caste in another.

card.name: Quirion Ranger
card.ability: Return a Forest you control to its owner's hand: Untap target creature. Activate this ability only once each turn.
card.flavor: "I went to the woods because I wished to live deliberately." - Henry David Thoreau, Walden
card.ruling: 10/4/2004: It can target an untapped creature.

card.name: Rancor
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+0 and has trample.
When Rancor is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, return Rancor to its owner's hand.
card.flavor: Hatred outlives the hateful.
card.ruling: 7/1/2012: If the target of Rancor when it's cast as a spell is an illegal target when Rancor tries to resolve, Rancor will be countered and put into its owner's graveyard. It won't return to its owner's hand.

card.name: Reanimate
card.ability: Put target creature card from a graveyard onto the battlefield under your control. You lose life equal to its converted mana cost.
card.flavor: "You will learn to earn death."—Volrath
card.ruling: 12/1/2004: You lose life equal to the converted mana cost of the card you're bringing back, so if you Reanimate Volrath's Shapeshifter, you lose three life, regardless of what the next card down is.

card.name: Reliquary Tower
card.ability:
You have no maximum hand size.
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
card.flavor: Once guarded by the Knights of the Reliquary, the tower stands now protected only by its own remoteness, its dusty treasures open to plunder by anyone.
card.ruling: 2/1/2009: If multiple effects modify your hand size, apply them in timestamp order. For example, if you put Null Profusion (an enchantment that says your maximum hand size is two) onto the battlefield and then put Reliquary Tower onto the battlefield, you'll have no maximum hand size. However, if those permanents enter the battlefield in the opposite order, your maximum hand size would be two.

card.name: Remand
card.ability:
Counter target spell. If that spell is countered this way, put it into its owner's hand instead of into that player's graveyard.
Draw a card.
card.flavor: Well, at least all of that arm-waving and arcane babbling you did was impressive.
card.ruling:
10/1/2005: The countered spell goes to its owner's hand from the stack. It never hits the graveyard.

2/1/2007: If you Remand a card with Flashback, the card will still be exiled.

card.name: Resurrection
card.ability: Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield.
card.flavor: “Think of this new life not as a gift from the angels but as a command to fight for their cause once more.” -War blessing of Serra

card.name: Rhox War Monk
card.ability: Lifelink
card.flavor: Rhox monks are dedicated to spiritual growth and learning, and most bear the sigils of many students. However, they do not gladly suffer fools or those who disagree with their carefully wrought dogma.

card.name: Rift Bolt
card.ability:
Rift Bolt deals 3 damage to target creature or player.
Suspend 1—{R} (Rather than cast this card from your hand, you may pay {R} and exile it with a time counter on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a time counter. When the last is removed, cast it without paying its mana cost.)

card.name: River Boa
card.ability:
Islandwalk
{G}: Regenerate River Boa.
card.flavor: "But no one heard the snake's gentle hiss for peace over the elephant's trumpeting of war." - Afari, Tales

card.name: Roar of the Wurm
card.ability:
Put a 6/6 green Wurm creature token onto the battlefield.
Flashback {3}{G} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

card.name: Sakura-Tribe Elder
card.ability: Sacrifice Sakura-Tribe Elder: Search your library for a basic land card, put that card onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffle your library.
card.flavor: Slain orochi warriors were buried with a tree sapling so they would become part of the forest after death.

card.name: Savage Lands
card.ability:
Savage Lands enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {B}, {R}, or {G} to your mana pool.
card.flavor: Jund is a world as cruel as those who call it home. Their brutal struggles scar the land even as it carves them in its image, a vicious circle spiraling out of control.

card.name: Scragnoth
card.ability:
Scragnoth can't be countered.
Protection from blue
card.flavor: It possesses no intelligence, only counter-intelligence.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004: Side-effects of spells that would counter this card will still happen, because they happen even if the spell they're trying to counter can't be countered.

10/4/2004: Spells can target Scragnoth and affect it while it is on the stack. Only effects that counter spells are ignored.

10/4/2004: Spells with a side effect that only happens if a spell is countered do not have their side effect happen when the countering fails.

card.name: Seal of Cleansing
card.ability: Sacrifice Seal of Cleansing: Destroy target artifact or enchantment.
card.flavor: "I am the purifier, the light that clears all shadows." - Seal inscription
card.ruling: 10/4/2004: This is not modal. If the target changes from an artifact to an enchantment or vice versa, this still destroys it.

card.name: Searing Spear
card.ability: Searing Spear deals 3 damage to target creature or player.
card.flavor: Sometimes you die a glorious death with your sword held high. Sometimes you're just target practice.

card.name: Serrated Arrows
card.ability:
Serrated Arrows enters the battlefield with three arrowhead counters on it.
At the beginning of your upkeep, if there are no arrowhead counters on Serrated Arrows, sacrifice it.
{T}, Remove an arrowhead counter from Serrated Arrows: Put a -1/-1 counter on target creature.
card.ruling: 8/1/2008: The upkeep trigger checks the number of counters at the start of upkeep, and only goes on the stack if there are no arrowhead counters at that time. It will check again on resolution, and will do nothing if you've somehow manage to get a new arrowhead counter on the Arrows.

card.name: Shock
card.ability: Shock deals 2 damage to target creature or player.
card.flavor: Lightning tethers souls to the world. - Kor saying

card.name: Shrapnel Blast
card.ability:
As an additional cost to cast Shrapnel Blast, sacrifice an artifact.
Shrapnel Blast deals 5 damage to target creature or player.
card.flavor: To the Krark Clan, every artifact has a trigger and a barrel.

card.name: Silver Knight
card.ability: First strike, protection from red
card.flavor: Otaria's last defense against the wave of chaos threatening to engulf it.

card.name: Slice and Dice
card.ability:
Slice and Dice deals 4 damage to each creature.
Cycling {2}{R} ({2}{R}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
When you cycle Slice and Dice, you may have it deal 1 damage to each creature.
card.ruling:
10/1/2008: Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

10/1/2008: When you cycle this card, first the cycling ability goes on the stack, then the triggered ability goes on the stack on top of it. The triggered ability will resolve before you draw a card from the cycling ability.

10/1/2008: The cycling ability and the triggered ability are separate. If the triggered ability is countered (with Stifle, for example, or if all its targets have become illegal), the cycling ability will still resolve and you'll draw a card.

card.name: Smother
card.ability: Destroy target creature with converted mana cost 3 or less. It can't be regenerated.
card.flavor: "I can't hear them scream, but at least I don't have to listen to them beg." - Phage the Untouchable
card.ruling:
3/1/2010: A creature's converted mana cost is determined solely by the mana symbols printed in its upper right corner (unless that creature is copying something else; see below). If its mana cost includes {X}, X is considered to be 0. If it has no mana symbols in its upper right corner (because it's an animated land, for example), its converted mana cost is 0. Ignore any alternative costs or additional costs (such as kicker) paid when the creature was cast.

3/1/2010: A token has a converted mana cost of 0, unless it is copying something else.

3/1/2010: If a creature is copying something else, its converted mana cost is the converted mana cost of whatever it's copying.

card.name: Soltari Priest
card.ability:
Protection from red
Shadow (This creature can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)
card.flavor: "Fire is the test of gold; adversity of strong men." - Seneca, "On Providence," trans. Basara

card.name: Sparksmith
card.ability: {T}: Sparksmith deals X damage to target creature and X damage to you, where X is the number of Goblins on the battlefield.
card.flavor: "If it didn't hurt, how would I know it worked?"

card.name: Spellstutter Sprite
card.ability:
Flash
Flying
When Spellstutter Sprite enters the battlefield, counter target spell with converted mana cost X or less, where X is the number of Faeries you control.
card.ruling: 10/1/2007: The value of X needs to be determined both when the ability triggers (so you can choose a target) and again when the ability resolves (to check if that target is still legal). If the number of Faeries you control has decreased enough in that time to make the target illegal, Spellstutter Sprite's ability will be countered (and the targeted spell will resolve as normal).

card.name: Spike Feeder
card.ability:
Spike Feeder enters the battlefield with two +1/+1 counters on it.
{2}, Remove a +1/+1 counter from Spike Feeder: Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.
Remove a +1/+1 counter from Spike Feeder: You gain 2 life.

card.name: Squadron Hawk
card.ability:
Flying
When Squadron Hawk enters the battlefield, you may search your library for up to three cards named Squadron Hawk, reveal them, put them into your hand, then shuffle your library.

card.name: Staunch Defenders
card.ability: When Staunch Defenders enters the battlefield, you gain 4 life.
card.flavor: "Hold your position! Leave doubt for the dying!" - Tahngarth of the Weatherlight

card.name: Stone Rain
card.ability: Destroy target land.

card.name: Swords to Plowshares
card.ability: Exile target creature. Its controller gains life equal to its power.
card.flavor: "Peace hath her victories No less renownd than war." - John Milton, "To the Lord General Cromwell"
card.ruling:
10/4/2004: If the creature has a negative power, the player does not lose life. It acts the same as if it had a power of zero.

10/1/2008: The amount of life that's gained is equal to the power of the targeted creature as it last existed on the battlefield.

card.name: Tectonic Edge
card.ability:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{1}, {T}, Sacrifice Tectonic Edge: Destroy target nonbasic land. Activate this ability only if an opponent controls four or more lands.
card.flavor:
"We move because the earth does."
—Bruse Tarl, Goma Fada nomad
card.ruling:
3/1/2010: Tectonic Edge's second ability checks how many lands an opponent controls only at the time you activate the ability.

3/1/2010: Assuming you can activate Tectonic Edge's second ability, you can target any nonbasic land with it (not just one controlled by an opponent that controls four or more lands).

card.name: Teetering Peaks
card.ability:
Teetering Peaks enters the battlefield tapped.
When Teetering Peaks enters the battlefield, target creature gets +2/+0 until end of turn.
{T}: Add {R} to your mana pool.

card.name: Tendrils of Agony
card.ability:
Target player loses 2 life and you gain 2 life.
Storm (When you cast this spell, copy it for each spell cast before it this turn. You may choose new targets for the copies.)

card.name: Terminate
card.ability: Destroy target creature. It can't be regenerated.
card.flavor: Like his mother before him, Darigaaz gave his life defending Dominaria from the tyranny of self-styled "gods."

card.name: Terror
card.ability: Destroy target nonartifact, nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated.

card.name: Thirst for Knowledge
card.ability: Draw three cards. Then discard two cards unless you discard an artifact card.
card.flavor: Raissa transformed herself into a vessel for the Watchword Codex, allowing the arcane lore to flow through her body.
card.ruling: 12/1/2004: You can discard either one artifact card or two cards which may or may not be artifacts. If you really want to, you can discard two artifact cards.

card.name: Tidehollow Sculler
card.ability:
When Tidehollow Sculler enters the battlefield, target opponent reveals his or her hand and you choose a nonland card from it. Exile that card.
When Tidehollow Sculler leaves the battlefield, return the exiled card to its owner's hand.

card.name: Tormod's Crypt
card.ability: {T}, Sacrifice Tormod's Crypt: Exile all cards from target player's graveyard.
card.flavor: Dominaria's most extravagant crypt nevertheless holds an empty grave.

card.name: Treetop Village
card.ability:
Treetop Village enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.
{1}{G}: Treetop Village becomes a 3/3 green Ape creature with trample until end of turn. It's still a land. (If it would assign enough damage to its blockers to destroy them, you may have it assign the rest of its damage to defending player or planeswalker.)
card.ruling:
8/1/2008: A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature is subject to the "summoning sickness" rule: It can only attack, and its {T} abilities can only be activated, if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of his or her most recent turn.

10/1/2009: The layering rules have changed. Now if you animate a land and its power and toughness are lowered by Mutilate or a similar effect, reactivating the land's ability won't reset the values. This is because you apply all effects that set power and toughness to specific values before you apply any that modify power and toughness, regardless of the order in which the effects resolve.

card.name: Volcanic Geyser
card.ability: Volcanic Geyser deals X damage to target creature or player.
card.flavor: My thunder comes before the lightning; my lightning comes before the clouds; my rain dries all the land it touches. What am I? - Femeref riddle

card.name: Wall of Blossoms
card.ability:
Defender
When Wall of Blossoms enters the battlefield, draw a card.
card.flavor: "Everything in Nature contains all the powers of Nature." - Ralph Waldo Emerson, "Compensation"

card.name: Wall of Omens
card.ability:
Defender
When Wall of Omens enters the battlefield, draw a card.
card.flavor: "I search for a vision of Zendikar that does not include the Eldrazi."—Expedition journal entry

card.name: Wall of Roots
card.ability:
Defender
Put a -0/-1 counter on Wall of Roots: Add {G} to your mana pool. Activate this ability only once each turn.
card.flavor: Root systems in Mwonvuli twist through currents of mana rather than soil.

card.name: Watchwolf
card.flavor: Only in Ravnica do the wolves watch the flock.

card.name: Whipcorder
card.ability:
{W}, {T}: Tap target creature.
Morph {W} (You may cast this face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)
card.flavor: His bolas whirl like galaxies, but it's his enemies who see stars.

card.name: White Knight
card.ability:
First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
Protection from black (This creature can't be blocked, targeted, dealt damage, or enchanted by anything black.)
card.flavor: "When good men die their goodness does not perish, / But lives though they are gone." - Euripides, Termenidae, trans. Morgan

card.name: Wild Mongrel
card.ability: Discard a card: Wild Mongrel gets +1/+1 and becomes the color of your choice until end of turn.
card.flavor: It teaches you to play dead.

card.name: Wild Nacatl
card.ability:
Wild Nacatl gets +1/+1 as long as you control a Mountain.
Wild Nacatl gets +1/+1 as long as you control a Plains.
card.flavor: "The Cloud Nacatl sit and think, a bunch of soft paws. We are the Claws of Marisi, stalking, pouncing, drawing blood."
card.ruling: 10/1/2008: Wild Nacatl's abilities check for lands with the subtypes Mountain and Plains. Those lands don't need to be named Mountain and Plains. Wild Nacatl will get both bonuses if those two subtypes are contained among the lands you control, even if they're from the same land (such as Plateau or Sacred Foundry).

card.name: Willbender
card.ability:
Morph {1}{U} (You may cast this face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)
When Willbender is turned face up, change the target of target spell or ability with a single target.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004: The trigger occurs when you use the Morph ability to turn the card face up, or when an effect turns it face up. It will not trigger on being revealed or on leaving the battlefield.

4/15/2013: If a spell with split second is on the stack, you can still respond by turning this creature face up and targeting that spell with the trigger. This is because split second only stops players from casting spells or activating abilities, while turning a creature face up is a special action.

card.name: Wing Shards
card.ability:
Target player sacrifices an attacking creature.
Storm (When you cast this spell, copy it for each spell cast before it this turn.)

card.name: Withered Wretch
card.ability: {1}: Exile target card from a graveyard.
card.flavor: Once it consecrated the dead. Now it desecrates them.

card.name: Wonder
card.ability:
Flying
As long as Wonder is in your graveyard and you control an Island, creatures you control have flying.
card.flavor:
"The awestruck birds gazed at Wonder. Slowly, timidly, they rose into the air."
-Scroll of Beginnings

card.name: Wren's Run Vanquisher
card.ability:
As an additional cost to cast Wren's Run Vanquisher, reveal an Elf card from your hand or pay {3}.
Deathtouch (Any amount of damage this deals to a creature is enough to destroy it.)
